net.sf.mmm.util.search.api

Interface SearchCriteria

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Entity, Serializable, TransferObject
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSearchCriteria

    public interface SearchCriteria
extends TransferObject
    This is the interface for a transfer-object with the criteria for a search query. Such object specifies the criteria selecting which hits will match when performing a search.
    NOTE:
    This interface only holds generic settings for the query such as getHitOffset(), getMaximumHitCount(), and getSearchTimeout(). For your individual search, you can extend AbstractSearchCriteria to create a java bean with all the fields for your search. For searches in a database using JPA there is additional support provided by mmm-persistence.
    Since:
    3.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    SearchResult

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getHitOffset()
      This method gets the offset for the first hit.
      Integer getMaximumHitCount()
      This method gets the maximum number of hits that will be received as result for this query.
      Long getSearchTimeout()
      This method gets the maximum delay in milliseconds the search may last until it is canceled.
      boolean isReadOnly()
      This method determines if the search should be performed in read-only mode.

    • Method Detail

      • getMaximumHitCount

        Integer getMaximumHitCount()
        This method gets the maximum number of hits that will be received as result for this query.
        Note:
        This feature is the same as Query.setMaxResults(int) in JPA.
        Returns:
        the maximum hit-count or null for NO limit.

      • getHitOffset

        int getHitOffset()
        This method gets the offset for the first hit. This is 0 by default. By providing a multiple of getMaximumHitCount() you can simply implement paging.
        Note:
        This feature is the same as Query.setFirstResult(int) in JPA.
        Returns:
        the offset of the first hit.

      • getSearchTimeout

        Long getSearchTimeout()
        This method gets the maximum delay in milliseconds the search may last until it is canceled.
        Note:
        This feature is the same as the query hint "javax.persistence.query.timeout" in JPA.
        Returns:
        the search timeout in milliseconds or null for NO timeout.

      • isReadOnly

        boolean isReadOnly()
        This method determines if the search should be performed in read-only mode. In such case the result hits can NOT be modified or their changes will NOT be persisted. If a search-engine does not support this feature (e.g. for full-text search this makes no sense), it will be ignored.
        Returns:
        true if read-only, false otherwise (default).
        Since:
        3.1.0
